column4: does anybody know what the equivalent to 'rpm -qf' is for apt-get?
i've checked that of course, but I'm not seeing it... any ideas?
is q silent and f is what?
it shows what package a program comes from
if you have a red hat based distro you can "rpm -qf ls"
to show display what package the 'ls' command is distributed in
look into dpkg. not apt get
I'm having trouble with the syntax of dpkg-query, it definitely is the right road though, Thanks!
wow! so I have to start off with a 'which' to get the path? that's no good,
well it's fine, but not as nice as 'rpm -qf', to get the same functionality i'll have to write up a script and alias it
but thanks! that was exactly what I was looking for!
